hints_html:
Remember that for a 2 by 2 matrix given by

\(\begin{bmatrix} a & b \\ c & d \end{bmatrix},\)

the inverse is given by

\(\frac{1}{ad-bc}\begin{bmatrix} d & -b \\ -c & a \end{bmatrix},\)

provided of course that \(ad-bc \neq 0\)
hints_latex:
Remember that for a 2 by 2 matrix given by

$\begin{bmatrix}
a & b \\ c & d
\end{bmatrix},$

the inverse is given by

$\frac{1}{ad-bc}\begin{bmatrix}
d & -b \\ -c & a
\end{bmatrix},$

provided of course that $ad-bc \neq 0$
hints_raw:
Remember that for a 2 by 2 matrix given by

<math>
\begin{bmatrix}
a & b \\ c & d
\end{bmatrix},
</math>

the inverse is given by

<math>
\frac{1}{ad-bc}\begin{bmatrix}
d & -b \\ -c & a
\end{bmatrix},
</math>

provided of course that <math> ad-bc \neq 0 </math>
question: A 09
sols_html:
Using the hint, we have that

\(A^{-1} = \frac{1}{(1)(8)-(3)(3)}\begin{bmatrix} 8 & -3 \\ -3 & 1 \end{bmatrix} = -1\begin{bmatrix} 8 & -3 \\ -3 & 1 \end{bmatrix} = \begin{bmatrix} -8 & 3 \\ 3 & -1 \end{bmatrix}\)
statement_html:
Let

\[\begin{aligned} A = \begin{bmatrix} 1 & 3 \\ 3 & 8 \end{bmatrix} \qquad B = \begin{bmatrix} 1 & 0 & -1 \\ -3 & 1 & 0 \end{bmatrix}\end{aligned}\]

Calculate the following whenever defined. Otherwise state undefined and include a brief explanation.

\(\displaystyle A^{-1}\)
